statement.p: Suppose triangle A has angles \displaystyle{60}^{\circ}, \displaystyle{90}^{\circ}, and \displaystyle{30}^{\circ} and the lengths of the sides opposite are 10, 11.55, and 5.77 respectively. If triangle B has the same angle measures and the side opposite the angle of measure \displaystyle{60}^{\circ} is length 35, what are the other two side lengths?

solution.p: Because these are similar triangles we can setup the proportions below.
